title: Confirm current UI state is not the initial design

requirements.summary: Verify that the current UI state (version 35) does not match the original/initial application design, and document the remaining differences between the current implementation and the true initial state that existed before any mockup-matching work began.
acceptanceCriteria: A clear identification of UI elements that still differ from the original design
Documentation of what the true initial state looked like for key components (Header, HomePage, HeroSection, CivicSenseAnimation, ReportIssueDialog, theme configuration)
Confirmation that version 35 is not the target initial state

file_operations.description: Create comprehensive documentation file listing the true initial design state for all key UI components. Document the original design specifications for Header (navigation structure, styling, mobile menu behavior), HomePage (section layout and order), HeroSection (content, button styling, layout), CivicSenseAnimation (card layout, icon usage, spacing), ReportIssueDialog (form fields, validation, layout), and theme configuration (color tokens, typography, spacing system). Include references to which generated images were used in the initial state versus current mockup-matching attempts. Confirm that version 35 contains modifications from the original design and identify specific elements that were changed during mockup-matching work.

Create a detailed comparison document highlighting specific differences between the current UI state (version 35) and the true initial design. For each component (Header, HomePage, HeroSection, CivicSenseAnimation, ReportIssueDialog, Footer, theme system), list what changed from initial to current, including styling modifications, layout changes, content updates, color scheme adjustments, and image asset replacements. Organize differences by component and include code snippets or configuration examples where relevant to clarify what the initial state contained versus what exists now.

Add inline documentation comments within the CSS file identifying which CSS custom properties and Tailwind configurations were part of the initial design versus which were added or modified during mockup-matching work. Annotate sections that differ from the original theme system, particularly noting changes to color tokens, spacing utilities, and any custom classes that were not in the initial implementation.

Add developer comments at the top of the file documenting the initial Header design specifications (original navigation items, styling approach, mobile menu behavior, authentication UI placement) and noting specific differences in the current version 35 implementation. Include references to what the initial header looked like before mockup-matching modifications were applied.

Add developer comments documenting the initial HeroSection design (original title text, description content, button styling, layout structure, background treatment) and highlighting what changed in version 35. Note which generated hero image asset was used initially versus current usage, and document any content or styling modifications made during mockup-matching.

Add developer comments describing the initial CivicSenseAnimation design (original card layout, icon selection from generated assets, spacing and grid structure, typography styling) and documenting differences in the current implementation. Note whether the three value cards (Cleanliness, Safety, Responsibility) were part of the initial design or were added/modified during mockup-matching work.

Add developer comments at the component level documenting the initial ReportIssueDialog design (form field configuration, validation approach, layout structure, styling choices, image upload UI) and noting specific changes made in version 35. Clarify whether the current form structure matches the original design or if fields, validation, or UI elements were altered during mockup-matching.

Add developer comments documenting the initial HomePage structure (section ordering, conditional rendering logic for authenticated vs unauthenticated users, which components were included initially) and highlighting differences in version 35. Note whether LiveStatsSection, MapSection, or DashboardSection were part of the original design or were added during later development phases.
